lcn.p: It is part of the Jedi Code to live simply and keep only that which you prize highly. SW: Radio-SW: Ep5: Jedi that Was - Jedi to Be The freedom from clutter that comes from such simple living is part of what the Fourth Line of the Jedi Mantra is referring to when it says: "There is no chaos, there is harmony."
All that said - while for some people, living simply like this comes naturally - for many it is easier said than done.

Lucky are those for whom such simplicity comes naturally - but they are rare. Even those who's hoarded items are fewer than that of most people might still be clinging to stuff that isn't of any true value to them.

The key is to practice mindfulness of your possessions. Specifically, this means mindfulness as to your reason for keeping them. This could possibly involve going through any possession you are tempted to keep. Reflect on your motive for keeping it until it is either clear to you that the item truly is of value and why it is so - or until you no longer feel the need to hold onto it, and possibly even are to the point that your separation from it will not only be painless but also liberating.
